Utterance: Hi there! It’s great to see you again. How has your week been?
Hi, Ellie! It’s been a bit of a rollercoaster, to be honest. I tried journaling like you suggested.
That’s wonderful to hear! How did it go for you?
It was a bit weird at first, but I found it helpful. I wrote about my feelings regarding the breakup and some memories.
That’s a great start! Writing can often reveal insights we might not recognize otherwise. Did anything in particular stand out to you?
I realized I was holding onto a lot of anger and sadness. It felt good to get it out, but I still feel stuck sometimes.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: It’s normal to feel stuck, especially when processing complex emotions. It sounds like you’re making progress by acknowledging those feelings. Have you had any moments of clarity?
Yeah, I think I understand now that it’s okay to feel angry. I was trying to push it away, but it just kept coming back.
Exactly! Allowing yourself to feel those emotions can help you move through them. Have you had a chance to practice mindfulness this week?
I did! I tried it a few times, and it was really calming.
That’s fantastic! How did it feel to incorporate mindfulness into your routine?
It helped me focus and feel more present. I think it’s something I want to keep doing.
I’m glad to hear that! Mindfulness can really help in managing stress and anxiety. Now, how about your filmmaking goals? Have you had a chance to work on any projects?
I started brainstorming ideas for a short film! I’m excited about it but also a little intimidated.
That’s a natural feeling. Starting a creative project can be daunting. What’s your idea about?
I want to do something about relationships, maybe a short story that reflects on love and loss.
That sounds like a meaningful subject! Exploring your own experiences can make for a powerful narrative.
Yeah, I think it could help me process things, too.
Absolutely! Creating art can be therapeutic. How about setting a small goal to write a scene or outline this week?
I like that idea. I could dedicate some time to it this weekend.
That sounds perfect! Remember to be gentle with yourself during the process. It’s about exploration and expression.
I will. Thanks for the reminder.
Of course! Is there anything else on your mind today that you’d like to discuss?
I guess I’m just worried about moving forward. Sometimes I feel like I’m stuck in the past.
Classified_Subsection: History of Present Illness (HPI): Risk Assessment

Utterance: It’s common to feel that way after a significant change like a breakup. It’s important to honor those feelings but also to focus on what you can control moving forward.
That makes sense. I guess I need to remind myself that it’s okay to let go.
Exactly! Letting go is a process, and it takes time. Celebrate the small victories along the way, like journaling and practicing mindfulness.
I’ll try to remember that.
Great! I’m really proud of the progress you’re making. Let’s check in on your goals next time, and I’m excited to hear about your filmmaking progress!
Thanks, Ellie. I appreciate your support.
You’re very welcome. Take care of yourself until next time!
Bye!
